title: Samsung Galaxy S25 Edge and Tab S10 FE spotted on Geekbench
description: Two of Samsung’s upcoming devices appeared on Geekbench. The South Korean version of the Galaxy S25 Edge (SM-S937N) was spotted in a new listing alongside the global variant of the Galaxy Tab S10 FE (SM-X526B). This is not the first time we’re seeing the S25 Edge on Geekbench and it scored similar numbers to its previous two outings. The device is once again rocking the eight-core version of the Snapdragon 8 Elite for Galaxy chipset at the helm alongside 12GB RAM. Galaxy S25 Edge (SM-S937N) listing on Geekbench Galaxy Tab S10 FE is armed with the Exynos 1580, which debuted...
excerpt: The S25 Edge is expected to launch next month, while the Tab S10 FE is rumored to debut even sooner. Two of Samsung’s upcoming devices appeared on...
text: Two of Samsung’s upcoming devices appeared on Geekbench. The South Korean version of the Galaxy S25 Edge (SM-S937N) was spotted in a new listing alongside the global variant of the Galaxy Tab S10 FE (SM-X526B). This is not the first time we’re seeing the S25 Edge on Geekbench and it scored similar numbers to its previous two outings. The device is once again rocking the eight-core version of the Snapdragon 8 Elite for Galaxy chipset at the helm alongside 12GB RAM. Galaxy S25 Edge (SM-S937N) listing on Geekbench Galaxy Tab S10 FE is armed with the Exynos 1580, which debuted on the Galaxy A56 paired with 8GB RAM. It scored pretty low 1,015 single-core and 3,540 multi-core scores, but keep in mind that these are Geekbench 5 results and the device is likely a pre-production unit that’s not running finalized software. Galaxy Tab S10 FE (SM-X526B) on Geekbench We’re still waiting for Samsung to confirm its launch plans for both devices but rumors suggest the S25 Edge is launching next month while the Tab S10 FE series should arrive in the coming one to two weeks. Via
html:
Two of Samsung’s upcoming devices appeared on Geekbench. The South Korean version of the Galaxy S25 Edge (SM-S937N) was spotted in a new listing alongside the global variant of the Galaxy Tab S10 FE (SM-X526B).

This is not the first time we’re seeing the S25 Edge on Geekbench and it scored similar numbers to its previous two outings. The device is once again rocking the eight-core version of the Snapdragon 8 Elite for Galaxy chipset at the helm alongside 12GB RAM.


Galaxy S25 Edge (SM-S937N) listing on Geekbench

Galaxy Tab S10 FE is armed with the Exynos 1580, which debuted on the Galaxy A56 paired with 8GB RAM. It scored pretty low 1,015 single-core and 3,540 multi-core scores, but keep in mind that these are Geekbench 5 results and the device is likely a pre-production unit that’s not running finalized software.


Galaxy Tab S10 FE (SM-X526B) on Geekbench

We’re still waiting for Samsung to confirm its launch plans for both devices but rumors suggest the S25 Edge is launching next month while the Tab S10 FE series should arrive in the coming one to two weeks.

Via
